intro: Perezia nudicaulis, commonly known as the naked-stem perezia, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. It is known for its compact size and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and protected species in its native habitat.
